article.headline: Trump says heâll name Supreme Court pick on Friday or Saturday
article.body: President Donald Trump said Monday heâll likely announce a Supreme Court nominee on Friday or Saturday. Speaking on âFox & Friends,â Trump said heâs looking at five candidates to replace Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, who died on Friday. He has previously said he would choose a woman to replace Ginsburg. See:Amy Coney Barrett emerges as Trumpâs front-runner to fill Ruth Bader Ginsburgâs Supreme Court seat: reports. Trump on Saturday urged the Republican-run Senate to consider his nomination âwithout delay,â even as the presidential election nears. Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden said there is âno doubtâ the winner of the election should select a replacement for Ginsburg. See:Biden to senators: Extinguish the âflamesâ engulfing U.S. politics by not âjammingâ through a Supreme Court justice. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell is pushing ahead with plans for a confirmation vote, as Democrats denounce his move as hypocritical. The Kentucky Republican refused to call hearings for President Barack Obamaâs nominee, Merrick Garland, 237 days before the 2016 election. Opinion:Hereâs what has to happen for President Trump and Mitch McConnell to seat a new Supreme Court justice before Election Day. The Associated Press contributed to this article.
